text: <!here> I'm biomedical engineering with background in biomedical devices design, testing etc. Glad to be part of the project. What is the aim of the project? where is this going to be produced? in Ethiopia? Where are we assembling? Testing? Who is in charge of the design and test protocols

text: Hi thanks for joining. I am working on a project plan skeleton with design controls to collectively determine all the questions you asked above. We haven't defined our specifications yet. We will be having a kick-off meeting to discuss the points. The goal would be to have a U.S team and a team in Ethiopia to assemble and manufacture.

elements.text: Hi thanks for joining. I am working on a project plan skeleton with design controls to collectively determine all the questions you asked above. We haven't defined our specifications yet. We will be having a kick-off meeting to discuss the points. The goal would be to have a U.S team and a team in Ethiopia to assemble and manufacture.
Thank you

text: Selam <@UV8F3SRGA> it is excellent to have someone like you with such kind of expertise join this team. One of the part that I will be taking care of is the PCB layout design, fabrication and assembly. Please start to take a look at Medtronic's design file that was first brought to this discussion by <@U011D9WUJMU> . Looking forward for the kick- off meeting that Jerusalem is organizing.

attachments.fallback:
[April 5th, 2020 12:03 AM] misgana.oss: 'We propose here a ventilator design to be integrated into a hospital environment. The HEV (High Energy physics community Ventilator) concept is based on components which are simple and cheap to source, complies with hospital standards for external connections and operating modes, and supports the most requested operation modes. The starting point of the design is the set of MHRA (Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency) guidelines provided by the UK government regarding Rapidly Manufactured Ventilator Systems [13]. The proposal here is, at this stage, not a medically approved system and will need a process of verification with medical experts. However, in the interests of rapid development the concept is presented to generate feedback, corrections, and support as the project progresses. A demonstrator has been built and the design is now in the prototyping stage.'
High Energy physics community Ventilator (HEV) design and prototype from CERN <https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.00534.pdf?fbclid=IwAR3_XdRfi197BeNViH9y5De_Y0_kglhrVy_kWHgljzbzEUFd3BQfO9iA5VA>
attachments.text:
'We propose here a ventilator design to be integrated into a hospital environment. The HEV (High Energy physics community Ventilator) concept is based on components which are simple and cheap to source, complies with hospital standards for external connections and operating modes, and supports the most requested operation modes. The starting point of the design is the set of MHRA (Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency) guidelines provided by the UK government regarding Rapidly Manufactured Ventilator Systems [13]. The proposal here is, at this stage, not a medically approved system and will need a process of verification with medical experts. However, in the interests of rapid development the concept is presented to generate feedback, corrections, and support as the project progresses. A demonstrator has been built and the design is now in the prototyping stage.'
High Energy physics community Ventilator (HEV) design and prototype from CERN <https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.00534.pdf?fbclid=IwAR3_XdRfi197BeNViH9y5De_Y0_kglhrVy_kWHgljzbzEUFd3BQfO9iA5VA>

text:
Hi All, 

As promised, I worked on the project plan. 
Link can be found here : <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1N11eM-eSMTVBoThiBejkZj6Cq7aWwAUy/view?usp=sharing>
Link to Medtronic files: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=1DNLifXbI-vqsNMp9aK9SCCa1vZzcKaus>
There are two tabs in the spreadsheet - Business Case and Product Development Plan. There is a third column “assign to” where you can add your name, to take on responsibilities. 

I am also setting up a project kick-off meeting at 9:00AM PDT, on Friday, 8th 2020.  
Please add it to your calendar. 
Link: 
Join Zoom Meeting
<https://us04web.zoom.us/j/203593775>
Agenda : 
• Define role and responsibility for design and development 
• Define resources required (budget, team allocation etc) 
• Establish Framework of medical device product design
• Go Over Project Plan - Product Development Plan and Assign Roles

[April 8th, 2020 3:28 PM] jerusalem.darkera: <!channel> <#C011H7HG0Q5|proj-diy-ventilator> engineering team is in the ideation phase of building rapidly manufactured, low-cost ventilators. We need valuable input from our health care professionals to brainstorm ideas. We would like to get your perspective of the pros and cons of current ventilation in Ethiopia. 
 We need your help clearly defining ventilation problems we should solve that’d have the most impact for Ethiopia.
 We are calling for:
•          Doctors, nurses, and other medical professionals in Ethiopia
Please fill out this questionnaire: <https://forms.gle/aXh7KHv6gmLuSunb8> in efforts to help us gather user need requirements.
attachments.text:
<!channel> <#C011H7HG0Q5|proj-diy-ventilator> engineering team is in the ideation phase of building rapidly manufactured, low-cost ventilators. We need valuable input from our health care professionals to brainstorm ideas. We would like to get your perspective of the pros and cons of current ventilation in Ethiopia. 
 We need your help clearly defining ventilation problems we should solve that’d have the most impact for Ethiopia.
 We are calling for:
•          Doctors, nurses, and other medical professionals in Ethiopia
Please fill out this questionnaire: <https://forms.gle/aXh7KHv6gmLuSunb8> in efforts to help us gather user need requirements.
